attributes.action: Introduce rebates on low mileage vehicles
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The proposed new CO2 emissions based car tax is a crude and blunt instrument, penalising ‘low mileage’ 4x4 drivers, performance cars and most cars over 2.0 litres.

All vehicles of all classes have a role to play and should not be prematurely scrapped, devalued or owners suffer losses on the used car market.  This is a cynical tax – and has nothing to do with ‘green’ issues, or encourage car drivers to use alternative means – it’s really a tax on those who are proud to work for a living.

Lets take two ‘used’ cars worth about £8K - a small car say a Fiat Grande Punto which produces 139 CO2 g/km, compared to a Nissan Terrano at 260 CO g/km – but if the Punto drives twice the distance they will pollute more – yet they will be paying £330 less in car tax – how mad is that!

If the tax was genuine for ‘eco’ reasons, then they would encouraging all drivers to do less driving in all vehicles and offer incentives – hitting us with a big stick is not the answer. We are calling on the Chancellor to think again regarding the 2009 tax banding of cars and offer rebates for low mileage users.
